title: Jobless Claims Are Stabilizing at Pre-Pandemic Levels
sub_head: With tight labor supply, employers are reluctant to lay off workers
body:
Worker filings for unemployment benefits are settling at pre-pandemic levels as a tight labor market keeps layoffs low.
Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal expect jobless claims, a proxy for layoffs, fell to 211,000 for the week ended Dec. 4 from 222,000 the previous week. The Labor Department will report last weekâ€™s jobless claims figures on Thursday at 8:30 a.m. ET.
